| Overview                = The '''League of Nations''' was the most prominent international organization of its era.{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[Slorenia]]'s entry}}
| History                 = <!-- In Earth-1218, le league was formed in January 1920

 -->In 1920,{{r|Incredible Hulk Vol 3 12|: One of the prisoners states he was imprisoned for 92 years, while the comics was published in October, 2012}} the League of Nations built in secret the [[God Complex]], a vault five miles below the surface capable to house threats no ordinary prison could contain, using technology salvaged from crashed alien spacecraft.{{r|Incredible Hulk Vol 3 12}}

In 1921, [[Slorenia]], after having established its sovereignty, joined the League of Nations.{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[Slorenia]]'s entry}}

In 1933, [[Zheng Zu (Earth-616)|Fu Manchu]] plotted to kidnap the leaders of the League of Nations, but was stopped by [[Denis Nayland Smith (Earth-616)|Nayland Smith]], [[Lyman Leeks (Earth-616)|Lyman Leeks]], and [[James Petrie (Earth-616)|James Petrie]].{{r|Master of Kung Fu #81}}

In July, 1944, during a sabotage mission, G.I.s [[Hank Kelly (Earth-616)|Combat Kelly]] and [[Cookie Novak (Earth-616)|Cookie Novak]] came to have [[Adolf Hitler (Earth-616)|Adolf Hitler]] in their grasp. Upon completion of the mission, they shaved Hitler's mustache and dressed him in American G.I. clothes. Furious, Hitler stated that he would complain about it to the League of Nations.{{r|Combat Kelly #26|; Combat Kelly (4th story)}}

===Legacy===
<!-- During the [[Modern Age]], -->In 2012, the robots of the God Complex, serving as guards and caretakers, still operated under the mandate of League of the Nations.{{r|Incredible Hulk Vol 3 12}}
